Description: Two joining fragments, preserving complete profile, with handle roots, of North Ionian pottery bowl; low, flaring ring foot. Interior streakily glazed save for tondo; three added red bands lined in white; in tondo rather roughly painted six-leaf rosette. Exterior: top of rim glazed; handle zone otherwise reserved as far as preserved save for a blob of glaze; twelve bands on lower body; outside of foot glazed, underside reserved.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1070)
